terms.definition: Comprehensive written materials that explain how to use, implement, or understand a product, including user guides, API references, and technical specifications.
A centralized web-based platform where all product documentation is organized, searchable, and accessible to users in one location.
An HTML element that allows embedding external content like videos, forms, or interactive tools directly within a webpage or documentation.
An isolated environment where developers can write, test, and execute code snippets safely without affecting the main system.
The practice of creating clear, concise documentation that explains complex technical information to specific audiences.
HTML or JavaScript code snippets that allow external content or applications to be displayed within another webpage or platform.
A feature that applies color coding and formatting to programming code to improve readability and distinguish different syntax elements.
The practice of rewording existing content while maintaining the original meaning, often used to avoid plagiarism and improve clarity.
The process of taking screenshots or recording video of computer screen activity, commonly used in documentation to show step-by-step processes.
A sequence of connected steps or processes that define how work moves from initiation to completion in documentation creation.
The graphical representation of data and information using charts, graphs, and interactive displays to make complex data easier to understand.
Relational Database Management System - a database system that organizes data into tables with relationships between them.
Content (images, videos, music) that can be used without paying ongoing licensing fees after an initial purchase or under free license terms.
A writing style where the subject performs the action, making sentences more direct and engaging than passive voice constructions.
A measurement that indicates the education level required to easily understand a piece of text, helping writers match content complexity to their audience.
